meanings.sent1: She bought lashins of candy at the store.
meanings.sent2: There were lashins of books on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was filled with lashins of delicious treats.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was overflowing with lashins of gold coins.
meanings.sent5: The garden was blooming with lashins of colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a whip or lash.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy lashed the horse gently to make it move.
meanings.sent2: She lashed the branches to clear the path.
meanings.sent3: He playfully lashed his friend with a towel during the pool party.
meanings.sent4: The storm lashed the coast with strong winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef lashed the cream until it formed stiff peaks.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a rope or cord.
meanings.sent1: She lashed the tent poles together to set up camp.
meanings.sent2: The sailor lashed the cargo to the deck to prevent it from shifting.
meanings.sent3: He quickly lashed the broken chair leg to fix it temporarily.
meanings.sent4: The climber lashed himself to the rock face for safety.
meanings.sent5: The farmer lashed the scarecrow to the pole to keep it in place.
